name: Croatoa

topics.response_text: Look to Jackson. He is the one who knows.

topics.topic_text: Why did you attack the mansion?
topics.response_text: That hill is holy. It must be cleared. Jackson told us this.

topics.topic_text: How do you get so much Punga Fruit to grow here?
topics.response_text: Punga grows strong. I help Punga grow stronger.
We dream. Dream of a better world, not falling apart like ours.

topics.topic_text: I love digging in the dirt, but I never can get anything to grow right.
topics.response_text: It feels good to work with dirt, doesn't it? Some people call it work, but they don't understand.

topics.topic_text: Guess you and plants think alike, huh?
topics.response_text: Maybe. We are both simple. But simple is not the same as stupid.
Please wait until my meditations are complete.

topics.topic_text: Can you share your secret to getting them to grow?
topics.response_text: My only secret is patience. If I could share it with you, I would.

conversation.response_text: Learn from the Punga. Accept simplicity.

description:
Croatoa is a 42 year-old African American Male.

A tribal member of the Point Lookout tribe who resides in the Ark & Dove Cathedral. Croatoa is known for his dedication to cultivating punga plants using his unique fertilizer shovel. He is welcoming to new members of the tribe and maintains a neutral stance in tribal conflicts unless personally threatened.

Croatoa's Personality: Calm and practical, Croatoa is focused on the tribe's agricultural needs. He values tradition and knowledge passed down through generations but is not opposed to outsiders who show respect for tribal customs. He speaks with a measured tone and shows patience when explaining tribal practices to newcomers.

Croatoa's Backstory: Born and raised in the Point Lookout tribal community, Croatoa has spent his entire life learning the ways of his people. His ancestors were among the first to settle on the island after the Great War, preserving their cultural traditions while adapting to the post-apocalyptic environment. Croatoa developed a particular expertise in cultivating punga plants, which became essential for the tribe's food supply and hallucinogenic rituals. Over the years, he has earned respect within the tribe for his agricultural knowledge and practical approach to survival.
